item.title: NeuBtracker — imaging neurobehavioral dynamics in freely behaving fish
Context-based Normalization of Histological Stains using Deep Convolutional Features
Fully Convolutional Signal Transcription for Artifact Removal and Normalization
item.description:
Figure 1: A. Proposed WaveNet-inspired network architecture. Using recordings from ECG, EOG and EMG recordings as context signals, the network generates an EEG sequence matching the context signals. B. Demonstration of artifact removal C. Network learning curve

References

[1] Oord, Aaron van den, et al. "Wavenet: A generative model for raw audio." arXiv preprint arXiv:1609.03499 (2016).
[2] O'reilly, Christian, et al. "Montreal Archive of Sleep Studies: an open‐access resource for instrument benchmarking and exploratory research." Journal of sleep research 23.6 (2014): 628-635., 10.1111/jsr.12169
[3] Gal, Yarin. Uncertainty in deep learning. Diss. PhD thesis, University of Cambridge, 2016.
[4] Massetani, Roberto, et al. "Alteration of cardiac function in patients with temporal lobe epilepsy: different roles of EEG‐ECG monitoring and spectral analysis of RR variability." Epilepsia 38.3 (1997): 363-369., 10.1111/j.1528-1157.1997.tb01129.x

item.title: Building Robust Deep Networks for Medical Data Analysis
item.description: This talk was given in at the 4th HBP Summer School on Future Computing Brain Science and Artificial Intelligence in Obergurgle, Austria.

item.title: A Deep Learning Approach to Compressive Sensing
Improving Histopathological Tissue Classification with Transfer Learning and Unsupervised Pre-Training of Deep Neural Networks
item.description: If you are interested in reading the full text, please contact me via email
